definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: It is an anthology that crackles with wit and wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本妙语连珠篇篇充满智慧的文集。

sentences.english: He has a genius for epigram.
I enjoy listening to their witty repartee.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢听他们妙语连珠的对答。

definition: lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
(of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
able to reply quickly and fluently (idiom); having a ready answer
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
